content.description: Start on the far left side with your left hand on a black sidepull and your right hand on the slopey ledge. Go across the ledge to the other side of the rock onto the arete, and top out from there.
This is a super fun climb with a sit start that moves into an arête and goes up to the bomber hold at the top. It is on the lower left side of the overhanging part of the boulder.
content.protection: At least 2 pads, the mantel at the top is sketchy.
content.location: Sit start with your left hand crimped on a thin diagonal rail and your right hand is crimped on a (hard to describe) blocky feature that sticks out. Go up on edges and slopers, and then slap up the arête until you reach a tricky mantel move at the top.

content.description: Start sitting with both of your hands low on the left arete, and get your feet on - there are a lot of options. Make a few moves up the arete before reaching out right into the start of Phantom Arete.
content.location: Start sitting on the left arete down low.

content.description: This is a long traverse across the boulder using sharp edges, a horizontal crack, and slopers.
content.protection: The landing isn’t great, so a pad would be a good choice.
content.location: Start on 2 large edges on the face to the right of the overhanging face. Then go out left across the overhanging face using the horizontal crack and the slopey ledge until ending on a black sidepull and a sloper above and to the right of that sidepull.

content.description: Do a hard dyno from the center of the boulder straight up to the lip.
content.location: Start on two good black edges in the center of the main face of the boulder, and dyno straight up to the juggy lip.

content.description: Ship's Prow Boulder is an overhanging boulder with some potential for hard routes and a few easier routes.
